p: Significant progress has been made with respect to the electrification of bus transportation [2], [29]â€“ [35]. Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) purchased two electric buses in 2014 that were made by New Flyer Industries, and has been testing them in daily revenue service since October 2014 [30]. Each bus has a 300 kWh battery pack which is sufficient for a range of 80 miles. The city plans to add 20 to 30 additional electric buses over the next few years [30]. The CTA estimates that each bus will save $25,000 in fuel and reduce public health costs by $55,000 per year because of better air quality.
